subcategory: Stereotyping that Women cannot Fulfill Professional Commitments at Senior Levels

content.text: This refers to the biases and assumptions that exist in organizations that women cannot balance their professional and personal commitments effectively as they move up the organizational ladder.
A perception exists in organizations that females have family issues or will get married and take leave.
There is a typical mentality that females will not be taken seriously if they take up leadership roles.
Inflexible working hours hinder many women from succeeding in their professional lives.
Stereotyping leads to questions about the discipline and commitment of females towards their careers.
Organizations need to provide Sensitization training to males on how they need to treat females.
Organizations need to generate awareness regarding the presence of unconscious biases that hinder women’s development.
Businesses need to create female-friendly environment where females can contribute at all levels of the organization.
Organizations need to share the success stories of females who have achieved professional success.
Organizations may introduce a quota system to give opportunities for participation and visibility to women from different backgrounds.
